alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 12:48PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Morris, southwestern Sussex and northeastern Warren Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1248 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Greendell, or 8 miles southwest of Newton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Hopatcong, Blairstown, Franklin, Hamburg, Ogdensburg, Branchville, Andover, Great Meadows-Vienna, Allamuchy-Panther Valley, Lake Mohawk, Greendell, Five Points, Green Pond, Pellettown and Crandon Lakes. This includes Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 13 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
